name: series
content:
series noun [C]
(SET OF EVENTS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 a number of similar or related events or things, one following another: There has been a series of sexual attacks on women in the area. She gave a series of lectures at Warwick University last year on contemporary British writers.
a number of games played one after another by two teams against each other: The Yankees have a four-game series against the Orioles at home. in series
Parts of an electrical system that are in series are arranged in a single line so that the current flows through each part, one after another: If two bulbs are in series, there is a single conducting path.

(SET OF BROADCASTS)
